pages.text: When one finds oneself lost, or unable to find one's way, it can be difficult to keep a cool head - $(italic)a phrase which here means to stay calm in a difficult situation$() - and in some difficult situations, it may not only be difficult to stay calm, it may also be difficult to survive.

Should you find yourself in a difficult situation, the Pyrotechnic Esoterica contains many techniques and ideas that - through the act of starting fires rather than putting them out - will serve to dramatically increase the likelihood of your survival.$(p)For example, $(info) while looking at a Pyrotech inventory, $(sneak) to display item quantities; $(sneak) + scroll to insert or extract small amounts of items.

Another technique that will serve to dramatically increase the likelihood of your survival is the technique used to build a $(item)Campfire$().$(p)A $(item)Campfire$() is an indispensable component to wilderness survival and, as such, the knowledge required to construct a $(item)Campfire$() is a cornerstone in each new volunteer's wilderness survival library.

When huddled together in the dead of night $(italic)- a phrase which here means a time in the middle part of the night, when it is darkest and coldest -$() a $(item)Campfire$() can be used to heighten anticipation and dread while recreationally engaging in scintillating yet predictable tales of horror and misfortune.$(br)  However, for a person in your predicament, heightening anticipation and dread for recreational enjoyment is probably not a priority.

For a person in your predicament, a person engaged in the horror and misfortune of wilderness survival in a very non-recreational, non-scintillating, and unpredictable way, $(info) a $(item)Campfire$() is most useful for cooking food and creating light$() - light that will act as a comfort against the anticipation and dread that is inevitably heightened in the middle part of the night, when it is darkest and coldest.

This guide, also being an indispensable component to wilderness survival and a cornerstone in each new volunteer's wilderness survival library, naturally contains the necessary knowledge required to construct and make use of just such a $(item)Campfire$().
